name: TEXAS A&M FENCING CLUB
description:
Howdy and welcome to the Texas A&M University Fencing Club webpage! Here, you can find more information on upcoming competitions, practice times and locations, and how to get involved if you are new! We look forward to seeing you at one of our practices!

If you are interested in joining our club, you can find more information on our practices below or by contacting us directly at tamufencing@gmail.com

 

NEW FENCER INFORMATION

Whether you are an incoming student to Texas A&M or a continuing student who is interested in fencing, welcome!  We have fencers of all skill levels in the fencing club and we are happy to teach newbies the ropes.  That means you, YES YOU, can come and learn to fence even if your only experience with fencing is watching the Parent Trap or the Princess Bride.  HOWEVER, before coming to practice, please complete the Assumption of Risk Form because without it you will not be able to practice with us!  We look forward to seeing you at practice!

 

Times and Location

Our practices are held in Room 115 of the PEAP Buliding, which is the rectangular building just West of Reed Arena.

Map to PEAP

Practice times are Monday, Wednesday, and Thursday from 7pm to 11pm.  We often will also go to dinner together on Thursdays after practice to hang out and get to know each other better!

 

Dues

Dues are $80 for a single semester or $140 for a school year. Students are allowed to come to 3 practices in a given semester before we will request for them to pay dues.
summary: Howdy and welcome to the Texas A&M University Fencing Club webpage! Here, you can find more information on upcoming competitions, practice times and locations, and how to get involved if you are new! We look forward to seeing you at one of our practices!
